cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 365 mi (590 km) SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn northwest, slow its forward speed, and approach the middle Texas coast before stalling through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast (near Corpus Christi–Port O'Connor, TX)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A – system never approaches the Great Lakes

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch: south of Port Mansfield, TX to Mouth of Rio Grande and north of San Luis Pass to High Island, TX; Hurricane Watch: south of Port Mansfield, TX to Mouth of Rio Grande; Tropical Storm Watch: south of Mouth of Rio Grande to Boca de Catan, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning: Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass, TX; Hurricane Warning: Port Mansfield to Matagorda, TX; Tropical Storm Warning: north of Matagorda to High Island, TX and south of Port Mansfield to Mouth of Rio Grande
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast with possible impacts extending into southwestern Louisiana
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: None – cyclone remains over 1,000 mi away
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (Detroit not listed in the wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: No significant tropical-cyclone–related winds expected at Detroit-Wayne County Port, MI
